results.title: Geyser melodies
results.creator_credit: Guy Haselton and Guy O Hasleton Productions
results.brief_description: The world’s greatest display of geysers and hot springs in Yellowstone National Park in North America. Shown as being closely akin to nature’s most awesome spectacle - volcanoes. Designed to promote a better understanding of the earth’s beginnings and to show the artistry of nature in one of its most spectacular forms.

results.title: Gettysburg
results.creator_credit: Turner Pictures, Robert Katz, Moctesuma Esparza and Ronald F Maxwell
results.brief_description: The American Civil War raged for nearly four years and cost over 642,000 men their lives. In a single battle, during three days of brutal combat in the town of gettysburg, nearly 50,000 soldiers were killed - more than during all the years of the Vietnam War. Though it recounts one of the bloodiest chapters in history, this film is about more than just statistics - it is the story of ordinary men caught in an extraordinary battle to fight for their beliefs and freedom. An all star cast headed by Martin Sheen, Tom Berenger, Jeff Daniels and Sam Elliot bring these remarkable characters to life in a thrilling epic that captures powerful emotions and showcases some of the most awesome action sequences ever filmed!

results.title: Getting yourself across
results.brief_description: Describes the art the speaker’s personality plays in getting ideas across to the audience. Shows how a speaker’s interest, preparation, sincerity, vitality, and confidence bring about a successful communication. Correlated with the book “General speech” by Baird and Knower.

results.title: Getting your act together!
results.creator_credit: Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology. Communication Services Unit. Television Studios and Sue Johnston
results.brief_description: Feeling lost and alone on a large tertiary campus is not an uncommon feeling among new students. Students talk about their expectations, and experiences of tertiary education. Advice is given on finance, housing, study skills and personal support.

results.title: Getting wet
results.creator_credit: Chris Fitchett, AFTRS and P.J. Hogan
results.brief_description: Fifteen-year-old Alex has always adored Brenda, who has helped his mother around the house for years, but she hardly notices him. When his mother asks Brenda to go on their annual beach holiday to help her out, Alex thinks his chance has come to impress her. But, as usual, it is his older brother Michael who gets the girl. Alex thinks he will never be happy again - until he meets Margaret and his adolescent fantasies come true.

results.title: Getting wet
results.creator_credit: Chris Fitchett, AFTRS and P.J. Hogan
results.brief_description: Fifteen year old Alex and his older brother, Michael both like the same girl who has worked in their family pub for years. When she accompanies the family on a holiday to the beach, Alex hopes he can attract her attention, but as usual it is Michael who gets the girl, but there are compensations for Alex.

results.title: Getting used to the water
results.brief_description: Some ways of getting beginners accustomed to the water. A class is seen first doing confidence exercises in then later, and learning the correct way to breath. The children then practise gliding, kicking, and lying on their back in the water. Some other exercises are demonstrated.

results.title: Getting to know Wales
results.brief_description: This visually appealing tour of Wales takes in the castles, the countryside, the coast, and the buildings, takes us pony-trekking in the hills and revisits the investiture of the Prince of Wales. Narration by Richard Burton. No credits available.
